speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. A street.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Enter PORTIA and NERISSA

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Inquire the Jew's house out, give him this deed

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And let him sign it: we'll away to-night

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And be a day before our husbands home:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: This deed will be well welcome to Lorenzo.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Enter GRATIANO

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Fair sir, you are well o'erta'en

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: My Lord Bassanio upon more advice

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Hath sent you here this ring, and doth entreat

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Your company at dinner.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: That cannot be:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: His ring I do accept most thankfully:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And so, I pray you, tell him: furthermore,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I pray you, show my youth old Shylock's house.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: That will I do.

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: Sir, I would speak with you.

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: Aside to PORTIA

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: I'll see if I can get my husband's ring,

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: Which I did make him swear to keep for ever.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: [Aside to NERISSA]  Thou mayst, I warrant.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: We shall have old swearing

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: That they did give the rings away to men;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: But we'll outface them, and outswear them too.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Aloud

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Away! make haste: thou knowist where I will tarry.

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: Come, good sir, will you show me to this house?

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: Exeunt
